OGR608.name: Obstetrics and Gynecology Required Clerkship
OGR608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR608.description: Obstetrics and gynecology in inpatient and ambulatory settings. Clinical experiences, didactic sessions, hospital rounds discussions. Case writeups and presentations.
OGR608.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Human Medicine.

OGR609.name: Advanced Gynecology Clerkship
OGR609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR609.description: Additional exposure to gynecology in the preceptor mode. Participation in outpatient gynecology and inpatient care, including surgery.
OGR609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR610.name: Perinatology Clerkship
OGR610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR610.description: High risk obstetrics including prenatal diagnosis and counseling, antepartum evaluation, and care of the high risk patient. Management of the intrapartum high risk patient.
OGR610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR611.name: Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility Clerkship
OGR611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR611.description: Clinical problems in reproductive endocrinology and female infertility primarily in ambulatory setting. Occasional participation in inpatient experiences. Assisted reproductive technologies.
OGR611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR612.name: Gynecologic Oncology Clerkship
OGR612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR612.description: Inpatient and ambulatory gynecologic oncology, breast disease, and complicated benign gynecology in the preceptor mode. Pre-treatment evaluation and cancer management, including surgery.
OGR612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR614.name: Advanced Obstetrics Clerkship
OGR614.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR614.description: Additional exposure to obstetrics in the preceptor mode. Participation in ambulatory and inpatient obstetrical care, including surgery. May include maternal-fetal medicine.
OGR614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR615.name: Obstetrics and Gynecology Sub-Internship
OGR615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR615.description: Assist in labor delivery and in the care of gynecology/obstetrics patients providing first line care to patients similar to an intern.
OGR615.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
OGR633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR633.description: Based in community hospitals and ambulatory sites, this is a 4 week clinical experience emphasizing interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy.

OGR641.name: Obstetrics and Gynecology Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience
OGR641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR641.description: Diagnosis and management of common patient problems in obstetrics and gynecology.
OGR641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

OGR644.name: Obstetrics and Gynecology Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
OGR644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OGR644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy based in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
OGR644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
